Golden retriever - A must have dog

Their piquant attributes compose them enormous hunting dogs, steer and service dogs, and explore and rescue dogs. Their distinctive golden-haired coat gives the golden retriever a ecological glow. This versatile breed is celebrated in support of its prohibitive energy and playfulness.

The blond retriever is a member of the generous grouping. They are large, robust dogs which endure 20-24 inches tall on withers and weigh 55-75 pounds. The American Breed Standard calls for a coat to live a few shade of gold barring coats that are too dark otherwise exceedingly ignite. The British principles allow in support of lighter shades of gold, known as cream flag. A red or else mahogany 'gold' color is allowable beneath American system, except not below British rules. American goldens are typically taller and added small and have a longer coat. British dogs are stockier with shorter tails and legs.

Originally, the Labrador retriever came from Newfoundland. Fishermen brought the breed to England about 1800. All the rage the 1800's golden retrievers were urban in Scotland on the highland estate of Sir Dudley Marjoribanks, soon after Baron Tweedmouth. Blond retrievers were originally worn as hunting dogs to retrieve shot match birds and waterfowl.
